topic.title: Alt-Internet / Is this the future?
topic.body:
Hi,

New user here. I found out about ZeroNet a couple of days ago. I started searching the internet for a way to host internet sites that don't get pulled down by different powers in the world.
The idea came to me after I saw some news that the site RedIce.tv was taken down. I have watched Red Ice since many years back for their more esoteric videos and as of late their identitarian content. Now I see a site called dailystormer was pulled as well and company after company is going at it to oppress free speech and I do not like how things have developed.
This is why I am here.
I don't know if ZeroNet itself is the future or some other solution but I am really interested in the way it works with it's decentralized solution.

Let the Alt-Internet grow.

topic.title: Al Sharpton: America Should Stop Funding The Jefferson Memorial
topic.body:
Al Sharpton tells Charlie Rose that the Jefferson Memorial should no longer be funded by American taxpayers because Jefferson was a slave holder.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gg4XKIX1bs4

So, will we see the destruction of the Jefferson Memorial in the not so distant future?

topic.title: Mozilla and fact-checker engine join fight on fake news with George Soros
topic.body:
Mozilla, the non-profit which runs the Firefox internet browser, said Wednesday it was launching a drive against "fake news" as fact-checking software backed by eBay founder Pierre Omidyar got its first run-out in public.

The "Mozilla Information Trust Initiative" comes as an automated real-time fact-checking engine developed by the Full Fact foundation was demonstrated in London.
The group, which is backed by Omidyar and Hungarian-born investor and philanthropist George Soros, said its software is capable of spotting lies in real time, and was used to fact-check a live debate at the House of Commons.

https://phys.org/news/2017-08-mozilla-fact-checker-fake-news.html
***********************

What do you people think?

topic.title: Start buying .bit domains
topic.body:
From what we have seen lately you can be shut down in no time because of what you say. Personally I believe that free speech is the only way to go so I am worried that what we have seen this week will now continue with other sites.
This is why I think that .bit domains will be bought up in a rapid pace (I just bought a couple my self). Crypto currency will explode in use.
Get ready.

topic.title: How to view .bit domains on a Mac?
topic.body: I was wondering what people use to see .bit domains on a Mac (Apple)? Is there some way to do it on Safari?

topic.title: Swedish forum?
topic.body:
Hi,

I see Danish forum but not Swedish? How can this be added?

topic.title: Zero Talk Tree
topic.body:
I am setting up my own zerotalk forum and would like to know if there is any way in having sub topics? For example: 

Nintendo
-SNES
   ---Games
   ---Hardware
-NES
   ---Games
   ---Hardware
-N64
   ---Games
   ---Hardware

1_18C45ndJpnDbtgU7QdFxbfcENxBsPPEUtG.body: I believe Zeronet will get a LOT more users within the next few days. Whoever you guys are that made this possible, thanks, you are amazing.

1_177o9Aq6mWQ5remffUroniBUHinMmfWwNW.body:
I am new here and would like to know as well. It actually has a very nice interface, I just need to get used to it.
Are you guys from gab.ai? I have a feeling ZeroNet will blow up in users...
I think you can create your own zerotalk board by going to the main site, klick on the three vertical dots next to zerotalk on the left side, click that and a menu appears, click clone.

Btw, buy a .bit domain if you want to build a website so people can find it easily.
Watch this video to understand more what .bit is, it is a bit different from all other domains controlled under ICANN ^_^.

8_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY.body: Yahoo Mail was going in the toilet almost so they had to do this to survive. I have some yahoo and gmails but I will work to get off them as soon as possible, I just need to learn more about the alternatives that work good and don't sell your data. Yahoo mail is now together with Huff Po LOL!

> [akito](#comment_162_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): http://127.0.0.1:43110/14gSEpfWfF5Go7u5y7UidZQCnGa6eSBYZ9/ Provider -> Privacy E-Mail

I have to get used to everything first, I can't just shift.

1_14GQCrDpk3rprFJYe2Yc6hnG4ryhvE3ys5.body: Are there any hosting companies that host .bit domains?

6_18Cxdyc2FEuswoXnBkrAfCkM2Yu1p4NjcR.body:
> [rubit](#comment_4_18sV4LF2Q372BLkTJN5Z24HeRexQQscx1E): so they are now attacking the domain registrars, if they find content on a website they don't like...

This is why you should get a .bit domain because it is not under ICANN. A .bit domain can be used on ZeroNet so it is easy for your viewers to find your site.

"Government is not reason; it is not eloquent; it is force. Like fire, it is a dangerous servant and a fearful master. Never for a moment should it be left to irresponsible action.”
―George Washington
